comments:
I've tried to integrate my ecplipse-rcp application with springframework. I've
noticed that when spring tries to instantiate any dynamic proxy RCP falls into
infinit loop, CPU gets 100% load and the application needs to be killed.

my start method contains the following code:

public void start(BundleContext context) throws Exception {
  super.start(context);
  XmlBeanFactory bf = new XmlBeanFactory(
     new ClassPathResource("/bug/beans.xml"));
  bf.getBean("hang");
}

When bf.getBean("hang") is executed the application hangs. The same code
executed outside eclipse-rcp works well and without problem.

bf.getBean() tries to create a proxy class for given interface with standard JDK
dynamic proxy facility (no cglib or any other byte code manipulation takes place).

I'm not sure but I think that this may be caused by classloaders.

My environment: 
  Eclipse Version: 3.1.0
  Build id: I20050627-1435
  OS: Linux 2.6.12
  Java: Sun jdk1.5.0_04 

I attach a sample project which causes the 100% CPU load and rich client hang.

Created an attachment (id=24808)
simple RCP project which causes the 100% CPU load (possible infinite loop)

My friend tried the attached project on windows and he received the following
stack trace:

I hope this will help to fix the bug.

There is a bug in ContextFinder.

It has to do with generated proxy classes.  It looks like the springframework 
is using java.lang.reflect.Proxy to create proxy classes with the context 
classloader.  In Eclipse the default context classloader is ContextFinder.

ContextFinder is designed to delegate classloads to the appropriate 
classloader depending on the context of the caller.  In normal operation the 
ContextFinder should never define a class.  But the java.lang.reflect.Proxy 
class is forcing the ContextFinder to define the generated proxy class (I 
cannot be sure but I assume the Proxy class is doing some tricks to call the 
protected defineClass method on the ContextFinder to define a new proxy 
class).  This situation causes the method ContextFinder#basicFindClassLoader 
to return the ContextFinder which will cause ContextFinder to call itself over 
and over.

I will attach a patch to ContextFinder that will prevent the endless loop.

Created an attachment (id=24910)
Build version of org.eclipse.osgi which includes the patch

Piotr, please try out the attached version of org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0.jar in
your environment to see if it fixes your problems.  Thanks.

Thomas, I confirm that the patch works great and all proxies are now created by
Springframework without any problem.

Thank you very, very much for quick response to this issue!

--
best wishes
piotr maj

Glad it works for you.  Reopening bug...

The core team still need to review the code to make sure it is the correct 
fix, and release it before we can claim victory :-)
Fixed released for in HEAD (3.2 M1)
